etymology.description: 火(火) (huǒ, "fire"), 锅(鍋) (guō, "pot") - a pot in which food is cooked over a fire, typically at the table
etymology.interpretation: 火鍋(huǒguō) (huǒ, "fire" + guō, "pot") literally denotes a pot heated by fire. It refers to a communal dish where ingredients are cooked together at the table in a simmering pot of broth. The term captures the direct culinary method of combining fire and pot for cooking.

examples.chinese: 我很喜欢吃火锅(我很喜歡吃火鍋)。
examples.english: I really like to eat hot pot.

examples.chinese: 每到冬天(每到冬天)，朋友们围坐一起吃火锅(朋友們圍坐一起吃火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Měi dào dōngtiān, péngyǒu men wéizuò yīqǐ chī huǒguō.
examples.english: Every winter, friends sit around together eating hot pot.

examples.chinese: 这家店的火锅(這家店的火鍋)，又麻又辣(又麻又辣)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn de huǒguō, yòu má yòu là.
examples.english: The hot pot at this restaurant is both numbing and spicy.
